TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 18 minutes ago, Barzon Kerman said:
> 
> 
> What options do mods have? (e.g on a comment) Is there any difference in the interface?
> 

We do have more options for our interface, or else all we could do is yell and hope you guys listen :).  We can see threads/posts that get reported (so if you have an issue with a thread, use the report button instead of trying to handle stuff yourself), and we have options for managing threads, like moving or merging them.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Anyone have any questions about the forum? ﻿
> 

A forum is a place, meeting, or medium where ideas and views on a particular issue can be exchanged. In this case, the forum in question is about the Kerbal Space Program. The forum provides help for a varity of game play issues, mod questions, and a place to get to know other KSP players. 

Kerbal Space Program is a space flight simulation video game developed and published by Squad for Microsoft Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. In the game, players direct a nascent space program, staffed and crewed by green humanoid aliens known as "Kerbals". The game features a realistic orbital physics engine, allowing for various real-life orbital maneuvers such as Hohmann transfer orbits and bi-elliptic transfer orbits.

There, [@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/), I've answered your question about the forum. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
